column4: hey, i'm sorry if this type of thing should just work out of the box
but it appears ubuntu's motto is broken
because nothing seems to work anymore.
ok
headless box is a bit hard to install windows on
no the motto used to be 'it just works'
but it doesn't
why did he leave
frak
minicom is talking to /dev/tty8 is that the port i should put in efax-gtk?
what port is your modem connected to?
dmesg | less   read the output and check what port and stopp to SHOUT
sudo modprobe snd-intel8x0m   any output? if no output, pastebin "dmesg | tail -10" pls
and no output so.. http://paste.ubuntu.com/703962/
your problem is, that most modems are so called "winmodems" which use minimum hardware and the rest is done in win-drivers. those might work with linux, but most just fail.
try using "/dev/ttySL0" as device in efax-whatever
read line 89++ of your paste before, it refers to agere-drivers. maybe you need to get/try them
yea i saw from the scanout.00:1b.0 doc that the script output that it mentions the same
get the debs from http://linmodems.technion.ac.il/packages/ltmodem/11c11040/
but be warned: 3rd party debs might break things
thanks for the help though
too bad
